hints.content: ĆĈáàńň ýóòúù ṕṗíìćĉťțúùŕřéè áà ĺľíìńňéè ĝǧóòíìńňĝǧ ťțĥȟŕřóòúùĝǧĥȟ ťțĥȟéè ďđáàťțáà?

Yes. Here's what it might look like:

![A graph plots Life expectancy, in years, from 0 to 85, in increments of 5, on the y-axis, versus Average income, in thousands of dollars, from 0 to 60, in increments of 5, on the x-axis. Approximately 2 dozen points rise diagonally in a tight, narrow cluster, between (4, 69) and (52, 82). A regression line rises from (0, 74) to (60, 81). All values estimated.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2e37fd2247a82fbf1e1a01b152f9711b1012886a)

ŤŢĥȟéè ĺľíìńňéè ẃẁéè ďđŕřéèẃẁ ťțĥȟŕřóòúùĝǧĥȟ ťțĥȟéè ďđáàťțáà ĥȟáàśŝ áà ṕṗóòśŝíìťțíìṽṿéè śŝĺľóòṕṗéè, śŝóò ťțĥȟíìśŝ śŝćĉáàťțťțéèŕř ṕṗĺľóòťț śŝĥȟóòẃẁśŝ áà ṕṗóòśŝíìťțíìṽṿéè ĺľíìńňéèáàŕř áàśŝśŝóòćĉíìáàťțíìóòńň.

question.content:
The graph below shows the relationship between life expectancy and income in a random sample of countries.

![A graph plots Life expectancy, in years, from 0 to 85, in increments of 5, on the y-axis, versus Average income, in thousands of dollars, from 0 to 60, in increments of 5, on the x-axis. Approximately 2 dozen points rise diagonally in a tight, narrow cluster, between (4, 69) and (52, 82). All values estimated.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/14d2cdb01dbd0d4a08d0ffccbb1b69150356a6f7)

**What is the best description of this relationship?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
